review_title: Most fun VR game I've played so far
one_reviews_text: I understand it is crossplatform, and it looks like the different ship designs where made with each platform in mind.  My favortie ship is the Vulcan, where I can aim with my visor, steer and control my ship with my controllers.  Feels like i'm Boba Fet piloting Slave 1.  Keeping my rectical on my target with my eyes, while my ship is moving around is a mental workout that I enjoy.  Only bad thing is playing multiplayer.  Seems like it is all bots and nobody else is playing anymore.

I purchase your app for my Rift, works great.  I replaced my Rift with a new Quest 2. it is mental to think someone is going to repurchase your app for a newer hardware, but same system (Facebook). I refuse to purchase it again due to newer version of the quest 2 I have. I would like my purchase moved to my lol same Facebook account under my quest 2. BTW I had to replace my rift due to Oculus not supporting the purchase of new Headset cables.
when i first try to login into the game this massage showed up "oculus login falied" amd when i was tryin again its just fail over and over again every time
Cannot login
I really enjoyed that game, but it doesn't get any support from the developers. It was promising, but became like a child, an orphan

Extremely repetitive gameplay. There's no option to choose what game mode to play, when going into matchmaking, so you're stuck with whatever the hell the server feels like forcing on you...and as someone who cannot stand objective-based pvp, all but one of the game modes even remotely interest me. Gave the others a fair try for a few hours, and all it succeeded in doing was causing me to nearly put my controllers through the window. Pretty sure my neighbor thinks I just murdered someone with the cursing that followed. 

It also frustrates (or frustrated...past-tense I guess...since I will be uninstalling this) the living hell out of me how much damage is required to take someone out. There is no using your primary weapon in dogfights...it's a gatling gun, on a fighter that you can't keep level enough to hit your target before they're out of your crosshairs. So you have to depend solely on your secondary (homing missiles in most cases) to ever land a hit. 

Problem there? In the assault-grade space crafts, the missiles are multi-shot, meaning you can home in and fire up to anywhere from like 5 to 8 at a time from the space crafts that I played in. You can hit your target with literally the entire load, and it won't even take their shields completely down. And by the time you reload? Their shields are back up. 

There also seems to be absolutely no matchmaking based on experience level. 

So you're thrown into the pit with the same people that sit on their butts all day playing this game.

Translation? Unless you're prepared to put in the same game-time, prepare to be killed over, and over, and over. 

Massive reason why I hate PvP games, and why a game like this needs either a casual matchmaking lobby, OR the option to practice against bots of varying difficulty. 

Reason it kept any stars at all was because the flying itself is fun, rapid-paced, very intuitive, and easy to pick up on. It's just the rest of the gameplay that sucks.
No more way too play since the last update, no way to connect Servers ! A SHAME !

review_title: Close but should have been more like WC
one_reviews_text: Dog fights and combat is good but I feel the immersiveness is cut short when they stop the mission. I feel like it should have been more like a wing commander 3 & 4 experience. Where the story continues after you land after a mission. Story & Exploring the ship and then jumping in the cockpit for a dog fight is where it should be at! The foundation is there so fingers crossed for the future! ;-)
Terrible awkward controls and no option to change your pilot from male to female...Joke!  Keep this piece of crap DONT SELL IT!!!

review_title: The worst space game out there
one_reviews_text: This is the worst combat space sim that I have tried in VR, and I have tried them all. It might diserve 2 stars instead of 1, and to be fair, there are a couple of $5 space games that are worse. But being a full priced game from a known game company, this is horrible.

review_title: Could've been great but missed the mark.
one_reviews_text: Aside from the greed of charging microtransactions in a full priced game, Eve became just another space flight sim with clunky gamepad controls. If they would have made it with gesture controlled flight and motion tracked targeting this game could have been outstanding. Instead it was just meh.

Good game! Lots of fun to play and very immersive. The only huge flaw is that I can not reset the controls to their default settings. It gives me the option but when I click the button it does absolutely nothing. Also when I was trying to change the controls from and Xbox controller to the Oculus touch controllers, there is no option to "Save and Exit" or an "Okay" button to save the controls the Oculus touch. There is only a "Back" button and it doesn't save any of the settings or controls. This is an insanely annoying flaw that drove me crazy for a solid 30 minutes. I finally decided to uninstall and reinstall the program to fix the issue. Is it really that hard to implement a button that lets you save your controls the way you want them? What purpose do the control settings serve if you can't save the dang things....??? PLEASE fix this issue.

Paid full price for game. It worked FINE for 3 days. After that, system didn't worked with Oculus Rift Touch Controls. Searched and registered in website and surprised that no support/forum is provided. Overall, graphics OK but very difficult to control ships from touch controls. Also finding very repetitive and somewhat boring.
If you own a VR headset this game is a must have.  The immersion is incredible and the online play is fantastic.
Expensive game, with microtransactions and boring grindfest. It could've been good but developers got greedy.

review_title: Crash Low Level Fatal Error SOLVED !
one_reviews_text: Since Update Windows 10 1903 - No Sound in This Game !!! Please Fix the problem !
It's Not  Elite Dangerous That's For Sure?

I had this game at a 1 star for the longest time, mainly because the game wouldn't open for some reason; but now it does and I can actually play this game again. I've always had fun in this game, the community isn't as active as it use to be. I'm sure thats because this game is getting up there in years.

review_title: Really Great... just needs a campaign.
one_reviews_text:
This game is fast, fluid, beautiful. You really feel like you are controling powerful space ships with awesome weapons. 

There are two things it needs, however. 

1. The ability to release flight assist so you can turn sideways and backwards while keeping forward momentum. Would just be so cool!

2. A single player campaign. I don't need a lame story with voice acting and cut scenes. But I would like a series of challenges that take you from ship to ship and give you a reason to play and earn weapon upgrades, etc.

Fantastic game with just a few things wanting.
so fun have to sit do not stand lol  super real  with graphics turned up and the holograms are so nice super cool game one of the best def worth the money

VR isn't the paradize for greediness you were hoping for. You can't make a demo, tag it 50 euros with tedious grind plus micro transactions, and excpect to make profits just because you were the 1st one on this market. There could be 50 millions headset, wouldn't make a difference. Don't come back untill you learned your lesson. Might take a while from what I understood. Regards.

review_title: Best battle flying game in VR!
one_reviews_text: The flying experience is intense and beautiful in magnificently designed battlegrounds.  The subtleties of each ship in different classes kept me entertained and intrigued. Seems like there is no one ship which can dominate, which is great work by the game designers. Love the music build up during and towards the end of battles. Seems like I started playing the game a bit late(end of 2018) as the human players in the online mulitplayer mode are a bit sparse, however it is quick an easy to jump into an online game, without having to wait for ages for other players, which is a major plus. Playing game on oculus rift with touch controllers. Thanks for a great game!

Eve is a visual and technical marvel. It could have been a truly amazing experience. Unfortunately, there's just not enough substance here to keep players coming back. The community is basically dead now, which renders a multiplayer only game completely obsolete. A more fleshed out single player campaign would have been nice.

You buy the game $ 59.00 and then you want me to buy a ship ! NEED TIME TO GET TO KNOW THE CONTROLLS did better on flight sims. time to short, cannot tell if you damage the other ship. It's been A year and havn't miss this game at all. It just going to a web site that not oculus.

The menus and the setup of controllers, must be the stupidest UI i have seen in 45 years, and I've seen quite a few! Those game designers should be ashamed.

For a week. That's how long it took me to figure it out (sort of). But then, after a week of shame, they can be proud. This game is magnificent. The feeling, once you figure out flying controls, is mindblowing. I have litterally felt my stomach turn during negative G.

A HOTAS joystick is not a must, but you need one. That's where things get really hairy. My x52 is known to have buggy software, but once I had it up and running, and found a way to disable "clutch?" it works.

The forum where all the infomation about the game was, has been closed, so you are on your own. Most Google searches end up leading back to the closed forum. Hello?

Instead you are forced to experiment with button mapping. On my x52 there are 30+ to learn the numbers of by heart, and until you accidentially disable VR in one menu, you are wearing your headset, while guessing buttons in total blindness, during uncountable amounts of button mapping attempts. The menu design makes this a nightmare. Google it.

I hope my message is "clear". I love this game as much as i hate it. 3 stars could have been even 6, if only the UI wasn't such a mess.

Once you

It gives you an option to switch from touch controllers to a gamepad, but good luck getting that to work. Every time I've played I use the touch controllers, and it gives me the controls for gamepad to use. I click over to use the hand controllers in options and think all is good, and I'm back to gamepad again, while I have touch controllers in my hand. If you go into options "in game" your spacecraft doesn't stop in the sense of a pause, so if your not quick enough you will end up going out of bounds. The only reason I'm giving this 2 stars is because the graphics are pretty nice, but otherwise I can't recommend it.

review_title: Might be good - but unplayable glitch
one_reviews_text: Looks like it might be good but glitch that does not allow centering (controls above my head even when standing) make this game not worth playing.  There may be a fix but have not found it yet.  Very disappointing.
fun for a while. No sickness while in combat for me. Awesome style.

Final update 2022-01-15

DON'T BUY THIS GAME!!!
It doesn't work anymore... not at all
Unless navigating menus is your thing
Original review (somewhere in 2018)
I spent an entire afternoon chasing fighters in tight circles, I know that's what they mean by "dogfight", but it seems so pointless.
As far as I can see there is no objective other than shooting (enemy) fighters or getting shot by them, a fight you cannot win... ever

I'll  give it some more time, who knows maybe I missed something ;) (no pun intended)

Update

I've played it some more, it kinda grows on you but not 1 star more.
Do you know why? The dev(s) had the ingenious idea to add a disable option to the Rifts motion controller setup, and when you scroll over it your control is instantly disabled, yup, no keyboard or mouse or x-box controller can help you now, only task manager can (CTRL-ALT-DEL)

Dev(s) Where did you get your degree(s)? Out of a pack of cornflakes?
You guys are a whole new category of dumb.

Find someone, anyone at all, who's not near braindead, who HAS (at least) one living brain cell who can fix this disaster.
Here's how... remove the option to disable all control.
No one in their right mind would consider irreversibly disabling controller(s) as long as they (may) still need it... stuuuupiiid

No Battles Found. If anyone is thinking about buying this game right now.. I'd advise you to wait.. they might of just shut it down. :( 

It was a pretty fun VR space shooter... I'm going to be sad if they just shut the whole thing down. I can't get a refund because I bought it just a little while ago. I had it less then a year. There wasn't a ton of other players online anymore but I could at least play against bots.. now you can't even do THAT! 

Just gives you an error "no battles found"

Trying to set up a control profile for a joystic is almost impossible as the key bind menu is very very bad. spent about an hour setting the actoins for a joystic just for them to get wiped. As there is a profile reset button that relates to 1 of the actions and it doesnt tell u which one it is. so I didnt play the game as I couldnt be bothered to spend anymore time with the trash menu system

The games visual style and ship controls are amazing, but I didn't like the game at first because I felt like fodder for other players....I couldn't get kills and it drove me crazy.  After playing through all the tutorials and single player content I quit playing for several months....After deciding to give it another shot I've developed several strategies that have led to significantly better performance, such that I occasionally lead matches in kills.  Once you get through the growing pains this is an amazing game.

i7 6700
GTX 1070
16 GB RAM

So I played this game for couple hours, I'm using only HOTAS (as mentioned in title - Saitek X56). It took me a while till I get the controls but eventually I did (so no problem if you're patient). It's pretty hard for me to aim with fixed weapons but I love the idea of head-tracking missiles and turrets.
And most important thing is that the experience with the VR is much more less intensive that it suggests. I feel so comfortable, so don't judge the game by it's 
"VR comfor" rating, it's far less intensive than Lucky's Tale.

Superlative. Highly polished game and very immersive interface. The menu panarama
 is so vivid it took me 3 days to to reach out to the percieved drop into the hangar. I would recommend this to anyone who grew up on X-Wing or Wing Commander. The match play is like World of Tanks and there is NO Xbox Live verbal abuse and spitefulness as I experienced on that platform. Its a nice fun quite intense dogfight experience. And a major plus you can dip in and out without the need for dedicating hours and hours to stand any chance like with other games. This game is brilliant.

dont get me wrong,  this game is very cool, it makes you feel you are piloting that ship.
and everything is very responsive, graphics are cool and overall is a great game, 
what i dont like and correct me if am wrong is you cannot party with friends?  and multiplayers are pure random modes instead of a well organized modes to select. besides that its cool, but i wish i was better
I hope a patch comes out cleaning this up, the graphics are amazing..

As a pretty hardcore FPS player I found this game to be one of the best games I've played on Oculus to date. The learning curve is about 4-7 hours of play before you really get a good grasp on the piloting and the rest is just game mechanics.   Also my first review for a VR game... so yeah.  Great job CCP.

Eve: Valkyrie is blast. It's a competitive multiplayer space shooter with cross network play, so you are playing in matches that include Rift, SteamVR, PSVR, and flat screen players. There are several game modes that range from death match to a carrier assault mode. There are also a variety of ships and customizations for them. A solid pick for anyone that wants to fly around in space blowing other ships to pieces.

Bad bad bad and even worse controls. Navigating thru just basic setup and controls feels like i am a blind in dark cave and there is nothing but rocks in the way. Simplify, simplify and simplify. And trying to aim and shoot is like the ship has a alzheimer and hangover, i try to go up and overshoot it by a mile, it needs a fine tuning, or a bloody HOTAS.

I haven't put a lot of hours in but this is my favorite Rift game so far. Feels very complete and has a lot of variety. We'll see how the MP goes if more people get into this game (or don't). I life how the flight feels, immersive but not nauseating. I'm hopeful that CCP continues to build on this game. Grab it whiles it's on sale, you won't regret it.

I'm a pretty hardcore flight sim player. I play DCS and IL2:BOS a lot. Elite Dangerous is pretty boring, frankly, after the initial cool factor. I was worried this game would be a dumbed down version of Elite. It's not. In fact, I'd say combat is much, much more fun and engaging. This is space combat in a team deathmatch environment with GOALS. That means you  don't have to learn a lot of systems or have a million keys to bind. What you do have is some very fun twitch type space combat. You get to constantly do the fun part of space simulation (COMBAT!!!). It may not be strictly realistic, but by god it is beautiful. I have a TM Warthog HOTAS, as well as custom hand built rudder pedals, and they play just fine. In fact, I think this is THE game for my forseeable future. A straight up bargain at $15... I'd have no problem paying full price. To the developers: you are underappreciated in your efforts. Bravo!!!

A flashy but repetitive and ultimately boring Arena Flight brawler. Clinging balance issues and a lack of variety make for a game where dogfighting has been stripped to it's most bare of elements. A progression system exists but it is the most hollow and rudimentary one I have seen, for a game set in a universe as rich and as vibrant as Eve Online I didn't feel a single spark of what makes that setting so cool.

MASTER multiple types of ships and fighting styles. Or don't, your skill level has little to no impact on your actual combat in game just a case of lining up on a guy and hoping you kill him before the guy who has lined up on you has killed you. 

SIGH with disappointment when you realise you're going into another Carrier Assault map which means 15 minutes of running back and forth between capture points and ships and every now and again maybe shooting a glowy zit on the side of one. 

GET a headache as the abundance of lock on weapons means you will be spending over 3/4 of your game time with the thumping UNF UNF UNF of the lock on alarm as you mash button for whatever counter measures you have or just take the damage,  the real damage is the constricting blood vessels in your head.

ATTEMPT to use the support ships, then give up. 

CLIP into level geometry and bounce around inside it until you explode while the camera snaps all over the place and makes you feel motion sick. 

I mean. You could get it if it was on sale, it might be good for getting a few friends together, the miniscule playerbase on this game means that you will often end up playing against the same people multiple times I suppose you could squad up and try and troll the hell out of one pilot. Whatever you do don't pay full price for it.

The following prompt is displayed when trying to "finish install" at the last few seconds: "To continue, Oculus needs to install additional system software" and then stops - completely. Apparently its downloading 3rd party software or something. I tried restarting the Oculus store, uninstalling and then reinstalling again, restarting computer - nothing seems to work. I wonder if anyone can help me with this issue or I may have to refund this application

review_title: It is OK, but not very balanced.
one_reviews_text: It looks great in VR, and the tutorial had me thinking it was pretty decent. But after the tutorial, it feels like I am in a glass pea shooter going against tanks with Howitzers. I can see my shots hitting, but their shields just do not go down.   And I am pretty much fighting only the AI as it seems pretty dead MP wise.  Now if I am in the Scareb, a heavy fighter, that packs a punch, and the guns track your head turns. But the assult fighters just scratch the paint.

review_title: If it's on sale buy it!
one_reviews_text: Well bought this on sale and it is amazing for the price. It has a nice variety of different ships (that are all unlocked from the beginning), options to lvl them up to modify some abilities of the ship (+fire rate -dmg per shot and so) and unlock cosmetic stuff by playing matches. I was too lazy to configure my HOTAS so I used the touch controllers and it's very with them. After the basic tutorial that teaches you to fight, fly and use your abilities you have to do newcomer deathmatch (mainly bots) until you reach lvl 5 and go to the multiplayer action that offers different game modes. Grahics are nice and I don't get much motion sickness which I didn't expect in such a fast paced flying game.

Graphics are really nice. Actual gameplay is ok, but the menu's are laid out very oddly so i found myself bumbling around trying to get stuff sorted. While the game usues touch controllers it doesn't seem to be optimized for them. So you still have to look to select everything and listen for the sound, it's really annoying and counter intuitive. Especially coming from more recent games that fully utilize the touch controllers, feels like a large step back. Would be nice to have some actual hands to interact with the menu's  or at the very least pointers.

amazing game, one of the best looking vr games i have played, intense air combat, a bunch of cosmetics and customizations, and a insane veriety of ships to choose from, whatever problems the game used to have it doesnt have any more. people that say they have to play standing up are stupid, if you press the select button on your controller it changes the camera to where you are sitting. if you are thinking about getting this game you should, it is a fun competitive space shooter, reminds me of space battles in battle front 2 ( the good one).

review_title: Just a fun expereince with great visuals
one_reviews_text: I recently purchased this game, but have been eyeing it for a while. There really isn't a whole lot to the game itself, no real depth for the single player mode...but that really isn't what the game is about. This game shines in PVP. It is also one of the most visually stunning games in VR that I have come across. As much as I wish I could give this game 4 stars, because I love a good story line, I can't. Because now I am addicted.
fixed this with a change via device manager, uncheck power managment for sensors , also uncheck power management for USB 3.0 devices, sensors were disconnecting so after this change game worked fine

It's fun PvP game , i like it better than the elite dangerous arena. Plenty of different ships and nice maps. I play it with hotas and pedals which i got configured in matter of minutes.It doesn't require grinding which is a great thing it gives you experiece for upgrades but the upgrades can make the ships different and not better.
 I really find it laughable when I see some people think you have to play it standing straigh and you can't enable your touch controllers if you disable them :D

review_title: £5.99 Price of a couple of beers.
one_reviews_text:
Tip 1: For those that disable the touch controllers in error, use your keyboard to enable again.
Tip 2: do the tutorials, don't skip them.
Tip 3: Relive Battle star gallactica :)

Updating my review for 2018 --Stand and deliver 5 stars*****
EVE continues to deliver high quality (and mindblowing) space-scapes, technologies, and wormhole events. If you came into VR with high expectations of breathtaking immersion, EVE will never let you down. No other rating can be given but 5 for the incredible visuals, and the continued updates and support by the developers. A lot of love went into this game, and the community seems to appreciate it.  Still love it!

This game is a delight.  I am generally a single player experience kind of person.  I also instantly puke if the screen moves (instead of teleport).  I had reservations that this would be both boring, and I would puke the entire time.  Instead, I found this game to be pretty amazing.  Graphics are top notch.  Presentation is excellent.  Somehow this game doesn't make me ill at all.  This is probably the first VR game that I don't want to put down and I can't even tell why exactly... I just want to play it.

Im not really sure what to think, one of the first things i did was try and customize the controller settings. I got to one customization labeld "Disable" ...
Needless to say my controllers were disabled and I have not figured out how to continue playing since this apparently disabled the controllers completely. 
I tried restarting the game and it seems they are still disabled since i cant even get passed the main menu screen. 
I'm so confused by why this would be an option and how you are suppose to undo it??????

I highly recommend this. It's so much fun for so little money. Can be nauseating for beginners, but once you get used to it, the grand scale of all the ships and destruction around you took my breath away more than once.

review_title: Good game, some things need tweeking
one_reviews_text: Specifically what needs tweeking the most is being able to reposition where the pilot centers.  For whatever reason, I cant be sitting, I must be standing, and facing away from my oculus sensors.  Still plays fine but who the h whats to be standing for no reason.  If I boxing np, for this I want to be seated potentially hooked up to my hotas.

review_title: Awesome, and you CAN play seated
one_reviews_text:
I see some reviews on here saying you can't play sitting down. Well I have been. Hold down the menu button on the left touch controller and it resets the view. Hold it while sitting down and it resets while you're sitting down.

This game is extremely fun. The flying is intense, so if you're prone to VR sickness, maybe try 'aircar' in the store to see if you can handle the flying around. I find the controls intuitive (I use the touch controllers). This will be one of the VR games I keep coming back to.

One of the best cockpit PVP space shooters i've played in VR to date. The player count leaves some to be desired. The bots are extremely good for bots and are able to give the average player a challange,

There is one major problem with this game that is totaly breaking the fun. You are not able to play with your friends in a Squad that are owning this game on Steam. You get droped into games with random players against squads with 3-5 dudes and there is no posibilyty to set any option to prevent this to happen. Those fights are nowhere fair and suck. Dont buy this game in Oculus Store if you like to play this game with other friends on Steam or you will be stuck alown fighting with random dudes unbeatable squads. Normal matches are fun by the way but you end up with a higher level fighting against squads and loosing all of the games.

I think this game is incredibly polished. Brings back memories of Counterstrike / Team Fortress, but of course, sitting in a spinning cockpit with the world around you exploding is so much better! The levels are wonderfully designed with plenty of obstacles and debris to fly through and around. My only gripe is that the game lacks lots of explanation: What am I supposed to do and how do I do that? How do I read the HUD? How do I learn the features of the different ships other than taking them straight into battle and then finding out that I can't even fire as with my other ship? What do the little number indicators next to the names mean? How can I tell an actually player from a drone? Do drone kills count? I have to do research online to find out about a lot of these things. The carrier missions are intense and lengthy and I've never made it to stage 3. Without doing research online, I wouldn't even have known about the different stages. So, I wish for some more handholding in those areas, but other than that, the game is a total riot on the Rift! I'll be logging lots of hours!

Update: I see now, there is more training in the single-player missions. That is not apparent after the game dumps you into multiplayer mode after the first 5 runs. But it's true that this ame sorely needs a way to reset the view. I don't want to have to be standing in the middle of the room for the entirety of the playtime.

review_title: Superb AAA Game!... What a shame..
one_reviews_text:
Too bad the studio got scrapped along with forums & social media activity :/
Apparently only the Discord (community ran) is available. Wormholes dnt open anymore, & money is hard to get & XP transfers cost WAAAAYYY too much. Touch joystick sensitivity is asssss but i make due. apart from all that grief mentioned above, this is a super-solid game. Sets the standard for good VR development!
As an EVE Online veteran (9+ years), I was excited to see how this internet spaceship game actually looks like from another angle. It's such a nice change from the actual game, and it's fun!

played the game for 5 minutes, fell down, had nausea, vomitted. Asked for refund amd was denied becasue I didnt play the game the day I bought it becasue I was out of country. Unfortunate. Does look half decent though but nausea inducing

review_title: Really fun. More depth than it seems
one_reviews_text: This game is really fun. Use Oculus tray tools to up the super-sampling and it looks really good. Lots of ships and customization options I wasn't expecting. Its a pleasant suprise. Its kind of like the rebirth of Xwing vs Tie but in VR!

Originally, I gave it one star. There are bugs. Big ones. Anything but an XBOX controller will give you trouble. But if you give it time, set it up, and tweak the graphics, then this game is rewarding. I’d say it’s almost as fun as Robo Recall – my personal #1 VR title. If you’re looking for deep VR presence and flawless polish, there are better games to showcase VR. If you’re looking for a VR game that’s actually fun to play even after the novelty wears off, this might be for you. 

Many VR experiences are breathtaking, but few have a core game underneath that’s actually fun. Eve: Valkyrie is a welcome exception.
Would be a nice game if it was a sit down game. flying a space ship while standing? really??? � 10 bucks blown �

Very enjoyable multiplayer game with a good amount of ships playing different roles, assault, heavy, support, covert. Several maps with different ogbjectives giving each class its time for glory. A basic looting system. HOTAS X52 works just fine, and no issues whatsoever with an NVidia X52. All that is great except that I find quite mediocre that there is no chat mode or way to build up a team in-game.  Very good gamplay but I find this lack of in-game basic social features makes me claim that this game is unfinished. 20 Euros for an unfinished game is expensive. Now it is not necessarily a bad expense but you have been warned what to expect. I like this game but next time I see a game made by a hugely prestigious company, CCP, I will just skip it straight.

Works OK with Touch, but takes some time getting used to. Graphics are nice, I'm running everything on Ultra with supersampling set to 2 and it's as smooth as butter using i7 7700K and oc GTX 1080 (1783 Mhz GPU/11GHz ram). Textures could be much better, it's far from the texture quality of Lone Echo. Still it's an awesome feeling sitting in a spacecraft controlling giant cannons/lasers. Even if you're not that fond of the genre, it's a fun experience - it's an intense game, but I didn't experience too much VR motion sickness :-)
i nev er eerver gioo
Nice!!

When I first got my Oculus, this was what I wanted to play.  It was good, but a lot of the upgraded ships were pointless.  All support classes felt pretty much the same, the starting fighter was the only good one, and heavies were basically useless bait.

With the new update, everything is better.  Support ships are more varied (though the Banshee is the only one I enjoy playing) every ship actually feels unique instead of the same ship with a different special ability.  Multiplayer has grown a lot as well.  Where it was usually me and 3 other humans in a cloud of AI, now it is populated again.  The loot boxes are good too.  I don't have to waste as much scrip on appearance. 

My only gripe about the update was losing all my xp, but I am burning through levels ridiculously fast and have already mastered one support ship in 3 days (and I am a father of 3, so I don't play as often as many players do)

review_title: Can't team up with friends on steam!!!!

was looking forward to playing this game.  after making the purchase and downloading it.  Its faulty and wont work correctly.  Thus, if wasting your money is your hobby and not enjoying your oculous is why you bought this than go ahead download it

I play with dual joys and I have the best time. However...the latest update has messed it all up and it now tells me I have to use a keyboard and won't register my joys are connected at all. Unplayable until this is resolved!
As an EVE player... well, this has next to nothing to do with EVE aside from the clones. But it's cool as hell. Can't speak as to how it is on other platforms, but on the Rift it's amazing.
so i was in the prosses of changing the controles and disabled the touch remotes on accident and now the game is un playable..... waisted my money, no way to fix it back.
ffvcgfv
The game is ok.  Nothing amazing.  Setting the controls is a royal pain in the donkey...

Very polished game. Kudos for proper flightstick control. First VR game I went online multiplayer for. Really surprised the matchmaking was a quicker and more reliable than big name non VR games like EA's Battlefront. Update I lowered my rating to 3 stars for now. Though I love to play it, I've had some game stopping bugs. Before the last update, I went into battle with no weapons more often then not. Since the patch most of the time I launch it, I'm like 3 feet tall, my head is where my stomach should be most of the time. Even rescanning doesn't correct it. Unplayable for me right now
A huge pile of steaming horse manure. I was going to justify my opinion....but this just isnt even worth my time any more. The direction this 'game' has taken is just pathetic.

review_title: It could be a good game but...
one_reviews_text: The first time i installed this all was ok, i did get to play it and all was OK that was back when it was just called Eve valkyrie.But then i got an update, that should be a good thing but not with this no more play time for me just uninstall the game and Oculus home and reinstall over and over.The thing is all other games i have are ok, install update play.I have done everthing to try and get this to install but no joy for me, no errors in OVRRedistributableInstaller.log so don't waste any money on this on the Oculus store it should be ok on steam then everthing works on steam.

Nothing to it. Basically a grindfest, no campaign just some arcadey style single player showcases. 
The game is mostly designed for pvp.

Game works wonderfully. All controls are smooth. Would like more tutorial missions before being thrown to the wolves in PVP combat. All that aside I can't play the game because it makes me want to physically vomit.

Just got the game and did the singleplayer training program and it was a lot of fun. I already found 1 or 2 (There is actually a lot of ships 10-20 of them) I really like and will likely try out for some multiplayer later. I didn't track how long I was on and sadly Oculus doesn't either, but it felt like about an hour and that was about when my "played too much VR" symptoms kicked in. Game itself isn't really that jarring once you are really in the thick of it all, but after time (for me at least and this is common for most VR games for me) I had to give the headset a rest because my eyes were bugging me. Pretty fun tho, (since I played Robo Recall before this title) I would say this is the best thing since Robo Recall lol.

At first glance, the idea of flying thru space seems great, but once you get past the gee-whiz graphics, this is actually a pretty boring game. The controls are spongy, the missions are ho-hum, and there is very little guidance for the beginner as to what to do next. Plus, the game tries to push you into multi-player mode, which rarely works well, since players of similar skill are rarely matched up. It seems heretical to say this since this is one of the pioneers of VR, but this is basically just Space Invaders for the VR age.

review_title: Setup is totally confusing and no manual
one_reviews_text: Ive been trying to run this game for over a year but the setup is completely unintuitive and confusing with barely any touch support or manual. I give up

review_title: Looks nice, good game but not amazing
one_reviews_text: for that price range I expect more from VR games, compare to robo recal that game is boring for me. That should be demo like on E3 for free one flight to show experience that will be enought for me, because looks realy good. But some people may like it in multi.

Everything is great. Game is not crashing. Have everything set to ultra and its beautiful. When I first launched the game I was standing up. I then realized I better sit for this. I exited the game, got a chair and sat down, then re-launched the game. When I get into the game it still has it set for how I was standing and I dont see a reset camera option?! Everyother game I've played offers some kinda camera reset for when things get wonky. Ive searched all the menus quite thoroughly but cant seem to find how to fix this. Please help!

From all the negative reviews, I expected to have gameplay problems or problems with setup.  In fact, this game started off right from the start with zero problems and no more setup time than any other game.  I used an Xbox controller and it was instantly recognized.  I do plan on using a HOTAs next.  The visuals are good.  I actually like how even though you're in space, that the actual combat zone is not that big.  In fact, you're never really moving really fast unless you hit some type of special ability.  Anybody who is used to VR will not experience any motion sickness and if you do experience it and you're a VR veteran, just sell your VR headset already, you're not cut out for VR.  I found the gameplay to be fun.  And there's several ships with several different abilities.  I played solo, but I can see where a team of friends who know what they're doing can get very far as there is a lot of strategy involved with how the different abilities and spaceships compliment each other.  This is probably the best PvP space dogfight sim out there.  And yes, you can play singeplayer to train up your skills. 
 Amazing deal for sale price of $9.99.
Good matchmaking and very polished controls. Simple and fun space dogfight

review_title: best vr experience space shooter but...
one_reviews_text: this was the first space shooter i was involved in and even though it is the best space experience, it lacks a single player campaign that would take it beyond.  i have been searching for other space shooters and cannot find anything as optimized as EVE but like i said the lack of a campaign makes me look else where.  closest i found that was interesting enough(although not as optimized) was space rift: episode 1 on steam. but that campaign was only 2 hours long...

review_title: HOW TO SOLVE LOW LEVEL FATEL ERROR
one_reviews_text:
First, let me state this is probably the best sitting game.  Graphics are great, and movement does feel real.  I played this game for a long time, but one day I started getting a low level fatal error, and the game would crash on loadup.  I contacted support, and they sent me a reply, doing what they said solved the issue and fixed the error, the game now loads again.  If you get a low level fatel error on start up, its a third party software conflicing with the game.  Disabling the third party start up on reboot of your computer will fix the issue.  
______________________________________EMAIL FROM SUPPORT___________________________________
"Thank you for getting in touch with EVE: Valkyrie Customer Support. Our Devs are investigating this matter thoroughly and believe the issue may be related to third party software applying overclocks on your hardware. The ones we have identified so far as entering in conflict with EVE: Valyrie are ASUS Sonic Studio, MSI Afterburner and NAHIMIC. If any of these programs are present in your computer and running during your startup, please try disabling it and initiating the game again."

review_title: The texts have been translated into Span
one_reviews_text:
The texts have been translated into Spanish.
But the voices have not been translated into Spanish.

review_title: REALLY GOOD! BEST space dogfight sim!
one_reviews_text:
UPDATED for Warzone:
Really polished game and great for instant action! The publisher is very good about updating it's games and wow have they delivered! This game is now amazing! This is now the must own game in my book.

It's fun and I feel the potential, but the  shield drain beam in every game mode sucked a star off the rating. Also, Survival mode's fun until round 10, where there's usually 5-6 of them and you can't get near the group wihout losing shields... I wish the next wave wouldn't spawn until the current wave is destroyed. The survival mode is the same predictable scenario every time, where an AI swarm builds up until the collective unit aimbots you to oblivion. When engaging, AI loves to circle the player indefinitly, so the only way to actually hit them is to use the Specter Cannons while going in a tight circle, and looking directly up, this let's you shoot the bot AI constantly maneuvering to be behind you. IDK how to play this game with any other type of ship but the Specter now.
No controller support...gamepad simply does not work. It's a flight game which is not optimal with a mouse. Not sure why they would do that.

Great graphics and effects, well done flight controls. Classic MMP-Shooter elements. At least  I nearly got no motion-sickness. 
But as a novice player or as somone who doesn't play often such games, you don't have a real chance against others or the AI ... so it's very frustrating. At the beginnig it needs lot of patience and time to get a better ship with better weapons to have a small chance to kill someone without beeing destroyd within seconds. Until now this game is only for "pro-gamer" with a lot of time....

review_title: A little thin but VERY sweet
one_reviews_text:
Eve Valkyrie is one of the most engaging dogfighting games I've played. It's slick polished and a lot of fun. But after the short tutorial there's only a small rotation of multiplayer maps and modes and a couple of very light single player features. The co-op modes are great fun even if you aren't into multiplayer but you'll still have seen everything within a couple of hours. The game is enjoyable enough to keep playing long past that but £30 still feels very steep.

Oh and watch out for the comfort level. This is the only VR game that's ever given me motion sickness. If you haven't strong VR legs then steer clear.
This game is officially what I was hoping it would be. :)
Cannot play this as I cannot find where to modify the seating position.
game is unbalance with sh#t microtransaction...GG

EVE:Valkyrie has cross platform compatibility (Oculus, PSVR (Playstation), and STEAM/Vive) allowing players from all VR headsets to play one another; so there's ALWAYS players to be found. Game has a major update every few months that includes new features. Takes some practice, but you can become a competent pilot soon enough. Still one of the most polished games for VR: great graphics, high production and fun arcade feel to the game.  Been playing since November '16 and still come back to it every week. Overall, well worth the price!
This game rocks,best vr game around hands down for flight fans
..for f**k sake please stop updating the game, or at least stay away from telemetrydata. I lose my motion-simulator feedback everytime you guys update the game with something totally irrelevant.
It keeps asking me to click FINISH INSTALL, then says COULD NOT BE INSTALLEDm even though its taking about 20gb of space.  It's an endless loop.  Everything is fresh install.

review_title: Good Game, but not for me
one_reviews_text: Eve is a pretty solid game that is built with VR in mind. However if youre like me and prone to motion sickness, its one h*** of a ride. I played about 30 min before I felt so sick I had to go lay down. Those 30min I did play were really fun though.

No single player campaign for full price is unacceptable!
fatal error - fixed by disabling NahimicMSIUILLauncher in task manager start up!
Very polished, can't think of a single thing I dislike about it, no issues here with crashes, the game just worked as soon as it was downloaded. Money well spent imo.

I saw this for a long time and was REALLY hesitant to buy it because I had some other flying style games that put a bad taste in my mouth.  The ones where the ship just flies where you point your head and all you do is pull the trigger.  But EVE my GOD this is great.  Not only do you fly the ship for real, but the entire combat of it is unreal.  I give this a 5 star review with a warning to anyone reading this : If you are prone to VR sickness I would maybe try and ease into it.  I never got sick off of it (im of the few immune to getting sick fortunately) but it made me a little dizzy when it was spinning around super fast.  All in all...this is simply a MUST HAVE for your game library.

I paid $39.99 for this game and I feel it is worth the money at this price based on other VR games you can buy for less.  At $19.99 this will be a no brainer to purchase but for me I paid the asking price because I wanted a game that gave me the feeling of flying around in space and having a fun air to air combat experience.  This is the game for that.  I think it is a game I will continue to come back to any time I feel the need for this style of game.  I set everything to Ultra and it runs smooth on my 1070.  It is one of the few VR games I am able to play for an hour straight without feeling like I need to puke.  I think it is because the head tracking and controls are fluid enough I know where I am going to next.  If they add the touch controllers I will give this a 5 star rating.  As of now they continue to patch in new features including improving the overall graphics.  One of if not the best looking games on the Rift.

review_title: This should be a 5 star! But
one_reviews_text: This should be a 5 star! But not enough single player content, also adding the option to get out of cockpit in the hanger and looking around would have been welcomed.

This is what I thought of VR being when people first talked about it. This to me is the perfect VR or flying/dog fighting game. Beautiful graphics, excellent game play. This is really a fantastic game and they are constantly updating it (adding new things to explore, new ships, etc) and keeping in touch with players!

If you are motion sensitive, this game is probably not for you. It made me sick for the first week of playing, but it was so fun that I just took breaks and now I am used to it. The only complaint I have about the game is the lack of instruction for various modes. I had to go to the website, to look up what the objectives were for each mode. And I am still a bit confused...still leaving it a 5 star, as you can literally go on their site/forum for any type of help and pretty much have an instant response. Super support. If you love multi player, this is your game! Not a ton of solo content to play. But you do get right into the action!

Super game! By far the best dog fighting game that exists imo!

Because those other people won't be able to play. The STUPID requirement to buy another copy of the game on a different oculus account just to have a 2nd profile in my opinion is unsconscionable.

EVE Valkyrie is a great example of how a traditional game genre can be made much better when it’s designed to be played in virtual reality. Being able to turn your head to track an enemy ship as it zips overhead and aim a weapon with your face impressively utilizes VR's unique capability. It’s a whole new level of dogfighting, and it makes Valkyrie’s grindy progression worth sitting through. There are a lot of ship varieties to unlock, each with different stats and different weapon loadouts, so there’s lots of interesting combat potential. The problem is that progression through the unlocks is frustratingly slow.

Completely blown away by initial experience.  Controls are so well done. A shockingly short campaign though so if you heard of the hype...set single player expectations very low.  Multiplayer is well done with fair replayability but im not sure what game should really be worth.   Ship upgrades need much more depth but its not like any other game can even compare.  Play it till it gets old and then continue on with Elite.

Also not so fun constantly flying in a baitball hoping to hit someone.

I really like the feel of this game. I used to play a lot of Call of Duty, and this game gives me the same kind of satisfaction. You can play for long streches of time, or just pick up and play for 15 minutes and go on with your day.
Great job, developers.

This was a bit more than I was expecting... and a little less.  The positioning of your digital pilot self is impossibly high and far back and keeps cutting through when I move. There's no way to calibrate that specifically. I had to stand up and play which sort of ruined any minute sense of immersion it may have had.  The fact that I can't use Touch at all is a major disappointment.  I despise gamepads and bought these fancy wiggle sticks for a reason.  Other than that, though, it's outstanding.  Great graphics, intense combat. (Sometimes too intense and collisions make my stomach lurch.) Truly amazing HUD and straightforward, easy to understand controls and gameplay.

Looks amazing on a Geforce 970. Really fast, challenging gameplay with deep tactical options once you get used to it. 

The singleplayer had more to offer than I expected. Got the special offer for 50% discount. Really worth the money and I am absolutely happy at that price. But 60$ seems too much compared to conventional high budget games in 2D.

I come from Elite Dangerous, with its awesome flight and combat model and graphics.

I was expecting 6 DoF requiring my twin stick and pedal setup (the pilot uses twin stick in game!) and was disappointed.

Made me realise just how good Elite's CQC was, and that cost a fiver!

It was nice seeing the EVE ships though..

Its fun, amazing, stunning graphics, tight responsive controls but...It lacks something, I wish there was more to the story and the menus are hard to navigate i spent the first 30 minutes trying to figure them out.

Aside from that the gameplay is a bit repetitve...I wish they would add more to the story or maybe add more game modes

review_title: It goes in the right direction!
one_reviews_text:
Price seemed too high at the beginning but the new Content is very good.
The Wormhole Update gives Eve a good variety und there are new maps.
There is also a new League Matchmaking System (still Alpha) like in Starcraft 2.
Eve Valkyrie got a lot better with these Updates!
I hope there coming more Clan/E-Sport Updates in the Future.
If you like thrilling multiplayer action in VR - nothing beats EVE!
There always Players around.
If you want a Singleplayer Starship Snack, look at "the house of the dying sun"
It crashes on startup without any error message. It just loads for a few seconds, then shows Oculus Home again. Installing the latest update did not fix the issue. All other Rift games run fine.
It's a lot of fun and if you have experience with games like Elite, you'll do very well in the online matches.

Whats going on? What does this menu mean? What is all this information on screen? Is it meaningless? Why is this so boring, I'm in a space battle aren't I?These are the questions you will ask yourself on playing this game. Really the UI is God awful, navagation is a chore. The game itself is pretty dull. The Xwing VR mission on Battlefront manages to be 10 times better and free. Not worth the asking price at all.

Im an ol' eve player (pirate -10) and picked up this bad boy while it was on sale. 
Wow! Flying arround battleships, between the split prows of  a mega! That was enough for me but, now it has hotas support so i dont have to use the pad(that was a game breaker 4 me as is teleporting and blink moving in games or no touch).
Pew Pew, pow and dust! So far so good! Off to pvp it up! put this into the main game!
love this game

Have to say I have been putting this off due to the price, but 50% off and I decided to go for it.... and I am so glad I did. I love playing space combat PvP. Once I sorted out the Hotas controls it was incredible.

Smooth game play, impressive graphics and no issues with latency.
The game is not bad, got motion sick really fast. The price is not right. I would pay 10 top for this game.

if you have wished to fight against bots 90% of the time then this game is for you £45 for a 10 min campign and easy flight mechanics...wish i could get a refund . 9/10 vr exsperience for fligt, but dull gameplay ill stick to robo-recall :(. as a spacefan its a good quick fix if you want a taste of vr for the day
Very multiplayer focused, and rather simple. The action is fast paced, but lacks the ambient space shooter feel of titles like House of the Dying Sun and the depth of Elite Dangerous.
Its the worse space simulator I ever played. What were they thinking when they made it. It feels like quick cash grab.  Don't buy it!

A great space dog fighting game for the same reason non-MMO FPS games can be enjoyable from time to time.  The time investment to pewpew is rather small, the visuals are great and the microtransactions are both optional and benign.

Its solidly a multiplayer game though.  Don't buy it hoping for an extensive single player experience.

The game has some good qualities: the graphics are great, the feeling of flying a spacecraft is great. 

Unfortunately, the game ultimately comes down to trying to fly in a tighter circle than your opponent. Granted, this is how virtually all multiplayer air/space combat games play out. But other space flight games, like Elite Dangerous, give the player a lot more to do besides fly in circles with an opponent. With Eve Valkyrie that's all you do. All the pretty graphics are absolutely wasted when you're only trying to focus on one ship that is flying in circles. You don't really have time to notice that cool looking capital ship in the background when you're busy trying to keep on your opponent like a merri-go-round. If you like flying in circles, great. This game is for you. If you prefer more free-flight time and linear movement that allows one to appreciate weaving through an asteriod field and taking in the beauty of a planet or sun, pick up Elite Dangerous.
Love it! One of the best games ever! This is why I play VR.
I relly like this game, Buts it is a little laggy

I got this game for free when i purchased my Rift. The immersion is amazing. Controls are fantastic. But then you realise the game is over within an hour. Havn't tried multiplayer.
I wouldn't recommend buying this as it's far too short, but if you got it for free like I did, then you are in for quite a treat. Much more forgiving than Eve Online the MMO.

The Wormhole update is fantastic!  I really enjoy being able to play as any of the ships!  I wonder if TEAM SPEAK would be a good addition?  I think with only  5 to a team it would help to talk to your team..   It is a game that will make you dizzy but if you are not botherd by that its great fun!!
its alright, i'd wait for a price drop, $15 would be fair
ELITE IS THE WAY TO GO

Sadly it isn´t made clear in the description: This game is mainly an Arena-Dogfighting game. It does have a tutorial with a little bit of background story to the eve universe, but it´s only that: a tutorial where all  the mechanics of the online modes are explained.

The online mode itself ist fast paced, very imersive and very demanding of your skills.  Teamplay is of course encouraged, there are ballancing and content patches from time to time.

A must for every Dogfighting-Fan
The Best and most impresive game ive played yet in VR. If you are a Star Wars and scifi fan you have to buy this.
Wow!!! This game really takes me back to Starfox and the nintendo 64.  This game however brings that game to real life.....well done!!!!!  Cant wait to play more.
It's really fun.

review_title: A great multiplayer PvP space game.
one_reviews_text: EVE was my first real VR experience that made me say "wow". It is a very fun game however I feel that there are balancing issues with the ships, pre wormholes update (which I have not gotten a chance to play yet) that prevent me from giving 5 stars. I feel that the issue comes from having to unlock the different ships which would give players a bit of an unfair advantage in some scenarios.
just jaw dropping

If your desire is to fly around in space shooting other people who are flying around in space, then this is the title for you.  It's an arena shooter -- think CSGO or similar titles -- with not much more to it, but if that's what you're after it does it well.

It has its limitations, but the dev team have been steadily updating and patching since release and will continue to do so.

The great Discord community adds a lot of longevity.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jpIeM-aNqnQ&feature=youtu.be
Find us on facebook @True Vestige

By far, an amazing VR experience. I enjoyed it. No motion sickness in a hour of game play. Keeps you entertained for at least a few hours but the battles seem to keep coming back the same every time, just new players. Interesting visuals and VR experience. Highly recommended if your new to OR VR. I picked this up from the experience with EVE online anyways so I figured it would be fun and it was a blast and then some!

review_title: One of the best MP games for VR
one_reviews_text: If you are not an invested SIM fan and just want some quick and dirty arcade style fun Eve is awesome. Cross play with Vive and PSVR makes sure there are always tons of people playing online.
wont let me accept the acknowlegdement total waste of money and no one has helped.  Dont they moniter these comments?

At first the game was very impressive. I mean who does not like flying in a squadron on patrol protecting a large capital ship convoy? This is the stuff of dreams, however how dissapointing when the mission fades out unexpectedly after just a few short minutes. I was confused but then realised there is no single player campaign! There is a few short missions which remain entertaining for maybe 30min. It is more if a tech demo than a game. They should have invested in a campaign! The most over hyped, over priced and dissapointing experience on Oculus yet.
I started to play, and noticed that it is vary confusing, and awakes strong nausea.

I enjoy this game, but it kinda kills the immerssion when my character is sitting in a cockpit the entire time, but I have to stand to play. Would be much better if I could sit in a chair and feel like I'm sitting in a cockpit.
Not enough content. Its Great if you are into PVP.
It's awesome, although with a little dizzy. Hope the next game from CCP, something like Gunjack. Go ahead!

The game is way too simple gameplay-wise and a bit too fast paced for VR in my opinion. It's hard to know whether you are playing bots or real people most of the time, and not a fan of how you have to play a certain number of matches to unlock more modes than just team deathmatch (with mostly bots). I always enjoyed Elite Dangerous Arena (CQC) much more than this, but the devs of that one never fixed the broken matchmaking system so CQC mode died. That was the best, had much deeper gameplay mechanics than this and felt to be at a proper pace for VR, was also less nausea inducing since it was slower.

The game is kind of fun at first, but once the initial wow factor of looking down at your body or out of the windows wears off, you are left with an overrated empty shell of a game.

review_title: Missed opportunity for a launch game
one_reviews_text: I find it sad that the game has absolutely nothing to offer as a single player. A pure PvP skirmish game as the star launch title is disappointing. It would not have been hard to had a single player campaing with escorts, skirmishes, races, boss fights, etc. They chose not, therefore the game is very limited and felt quickly repetitive.

I was sad to finish the single player in an hour.  It was short and fairly boring.  Tried the multiplayer, but that was even more boring.  Good idea, boring game.  Needs some exciting Freespace 2 style single player missions.  Glad I got this game for free because I would have felt horribly ripped off paying actual money for it.

I got this game for free with my Rift. The asking price is a little high, but if you've ever considered yourself a fan of space sims, specifically combat sims, dogfighting (not you, Michael Vick. Red Barons and Iceman/Goose) then you need this game. The action is excellent. The ability to track targets with your head, and even use it to control some weapons depending on the ship... it's the kind of thing gamers will be talking about for years to come, similar to the first time playing Mario 64. Wing Commander, Star Wars, Battlestar Galactica, you name it. We've all had the starfighter fantasies and this game delivers on an awful lot of that. If you want extended ship ownership simulations, go get Elite. That game's awesome, and has some excellent, deep combat if you're willing to put in the time. If you want quick arcadey multiplayer, get this. Note that the single player is a little lacking, but it's mostly to get your feet so you can go online and not have your face eaten immediately by salty old sim vets like me. 5/5 and I don't give that to multiplayer only games lightly.

Yes its cool. Yes its great to look at. Yes it is fun, but of all the games I have played this one is the only one that makes me nauseous. Something about doing a barrel roll while diving and looking back over my shoulder to fire rockets. I wish I could enjoy it because its probably great, it just makes me sick.

review_title: Worth Buying HMD Just for This imho!
one_reviews_text: Spent over 200 hours in this game and never felt VR sickness once. Totally nailed it CCP, The only game I've played where the playerbase can give input to the devs which is then implemented into the game, forever evolving into the perfect VR, dog-fighting, multiplayer, space sim. 10 outta 10.

First, I want to say that EVE: Valkyrie is a super game and also a brilliant idea for a virtual reality Simulator. But nothing is completely perfect, what you'll realize when you play this game for a longer period. It seems somewhat repetitive, as a result, it's a little boring.
But, I still think this game has potential and if the developers add new modes, it could be interesting for me again.

Stunning graphics but unfortunately I got motion sickness of this game... 
There is no support for joystick and that I found very irritating...  
It's a easy game to "get going" in and I understand why Oculus choose this as a bundle but it also makes the game quite simple, if you like another dimension to "VR-space gaming" I would recommend Elite Dangerous Horizons (with a joystick), it's a much higher learning threshold but it is truly amazing.

Spiderman told me that with great power comes great responsibility.  This game has the power to make your friends toss their cookies and blow chunks with the best of them.  Use it wisely...  

Game wise this is the game that gets almost everyone sick.  It is a great demo but only for a few minutes.  You would really have to workinto having your VR legs with this one over time.  Gameplay wise, I much prefer the pacing of Elite Dangerous than to the intense dogfighting.  For some reason I do not get sick at all in Elite Dangerous dogfighting.  The presentation in this one is top notch, and if you want an intense dogfighting experience, this is the game for you.

The first feeling is one of amazement.  You feel like you are in the cockpit.  From there it kinda goes downhill.  The game is limited to 5v5 multiplayer skirmishes.  Many of the things in the UI are not intuative.  The bad part, and maybe it's just something in my setup, is that the game pauses for a second every few seconds.  This is just a hindrance in the hanger as it snaps you out of virtual reality for a second while you watch an hour glass.  During the fights it always seems to happen right at the critical times, essentially ruining the game.
very short campaign, very fun game mechanics, good multiplayer.... 4 stars
It would be amazing with a full single player campaign. I need a Freespace game in VR!

Has a great multiplayer, however campaign is
really meh

review_title: A Good Attempt, but an Unfun game
one_reviews_text: For the price, this game contains very little content, and what content there is is not engaging or fun. Multiplayer only is another strike against this title, as it desperately needs a singleplayer campaign.

This used to be my favourite game on the Rift. I would load up a playlist of Mecha Anime intro's and fly around blasting away. But then I hit a certain level and the dificulty just went from like 3 to 579 between two missions. I went from being in even-matched bouts (about 50/50 statistically for me winning or loosing, fairly balanced) to getting constantly fragged within seconds from launch. And that just killed all the fun for me. And since there really isn't any single player and I have no wingmen to build up any other experience it's just been sitting here on my harddrive gathering dust.

It's a good game, the combat is fun and the controls are smooth. Everything here is top notch, lots of attention to detail. I wish there was more single player content beyond the exploration and wave battle mode.

review_title: Bad UI, Low Content, Repetitive MP
one_reviews_text:
Not really impressed with this one. There isn't much for single-player at all and the multiplayer doesn't have much of a userbase even with it being cross-platform, but that could change. However, the people playing it right now are extremely friendly and helpful. EVE Valkyrie is a nice looking game and the controls are tight and handle great, however there are a bunch of issues that prevent me from playing and coming back to it. The first is the terrible UI and menu system. Nothing is explained and for the first little bit I was beyond confused, not knowing what any of the modes mean or what the menu options did. During the few missions I played, there was narration on what to do.. however I was in the middle of dogfighting and couldn't pay much attention to the directions. It would be nice if there was some text on screen to supplement the voice. I couldn't even pause my game in the middle of single-player, let alone change my settings.

The multiplayer aspect of the game is kind of fun.. for about half hour or so until you realize it's all the same dogfighting until someone wins. There isn't much else for multiplayer content besides some fleet customization (colors), and daily challenges. I can see it being more fun if you have a squad of friends.. but it will still get repetitive fast.

This is a game you could play for half hour or so to scratch that itch.. but doesn't have much else to it.

The game was bundled with my Rift, but that doesn't make it any less of a game. The battles are intense in VR with friends; coupled with a mic it adds only more fun experiences for you to enjoy as you fly amongst the stars blowing people up. Fast, fluid, fun and a great introduction to VR.
Best Vr game ive played! quality and play are of an amazing standard

review_title: This game is ruining my life
one_reviews_text: 131 hours later, I can't stop playing it.  Everyone assumes I'm a hardcore gamer, but the truth is that in ten years the only other game I've played is Civilization.  Actually that's technically not true — I played Lucky's Tale since that was free, and it was fun until I beat it.  Then I bought Elite Dangerous and played it for 4-5 hours until I realized that it felt more like work than play.  I also bought DiRT Rally, but I haven't even bothered to play it — not once.  Why bother, when I have EVE:Valkyrie?  Do yourself a favor: Don't just buy this game, buy this game and join Discord voice chat.  That last part is absolutely critical.  Then you will be hooked forever.  https://forums.evevalkyrie.com/t/discord-what-it-is-and-how-to-use-it/2184

This game is worth the oculus hands down. I've spent hours with this game and I keep coming back to it. Especially with the edition of carrier assault which reminds me of Star Wars Battlefront 2. I just wish there was more content for this game.

(Got this game for free)
Its ok. I'm just not into space dogfighting. Going around and around trying to get behind the other player has never been fun for me. No now and not 20 years ago playing Red Baron.

I also didin't feal much inpact when being shot at. It felt like some one was throwing pebbles at my car. Often the only way I could tell if I had been hit by the missle that was closeing in is if my heath went down or not.

I enjoy this game, I can honestly play it for about a hour before i have to take a break from it. campaign mode is short.. shorter then i would of liked they focus on muliplayer but not many people actually play muliplayer so your stuck waiting for a match hopefully it picks up soon. I do enjoy the game, i rated it four stars because not everyone can play it... my wife jumped on and played for a very short time and got sick playing it. something i can agree on and can be worked on im sure.

Remember the first time you ever got in one of those sweet simulators at the arcade? Yeah, this game produces that same level of sensory overload. This is the sort of experience I pre-ordered the Rift for. I wish there were more like it.
This game is a MUST if you own an oculus, it was clearly built for VR and has very tense battles and the perfect formula of a space fighting simulator. Easy to learn, hard to master.

I've been playing this game addictively since April and I'm still going strong. Multiplayer combat is where Valkyrie really shines, and it's backed by the most supportive community of gamers I've ever experienced. CCP keeps tweaking and adding to the game, keeping it fresh and confirming that Valkyrie is great value for money. Many of the changes come from community suggestions too, showing that the devs really care about creating a game that we want to play. This game is a must-have if you own a Rift. See you in space!
Overload on the senses.... Amazing graphics, Its really fun, shame there's no interaction with voice chat? does it work? Feels like i'm just playing against BOTS...

As a space-dogfighting PvP game, this is truly great. The feeling you can get from intense battles against other players is really enjoyable
The game mechanics, while simple to learn, offer much to learn and discover, and as VR experience, i'v found this really imersive.
No voice chat really kills this title.  Feels very single player.  Esspecially since not a lot of people know a ton of friends with an Oculus Rift.
All it needs is a real single player campaign, then it would be perfect.
I loved it, i just need a break every now and then, it gives me a headache

review_title: Great game, but actually a bit repetitiv
one_reviews_text: Great game, but actually a bit repetitiv

For me its the best VR Game until now.
Good control, good sight and cockpit view, no VR-Sickness and great graphics
Needs voice chat... You feel alone.
Been playing this for a while, betas included. Lately saw a fresh player with the headset go ballistic. Like I do. Every time.
launches out of ship mind blown. Gets blown up up by another player mind blown. Gets 1st killed hooked and ready to kill again. 10/10 will play again.
I'd give it 5 stars, if I could actually chat with friends in it without having to use skype.
your review couldnt have been said better.

review_title: We ARE In a REAL COKPIT
one_reviews_text: You must have it !
